column4: : i have apt-get the new kernel, what do I have to do now ? i think it's just unpacked
the kernel, and the linux-restricted-modules for it
: i did "sudo apt-get install linux-image-686-smp linux-restriced-modules-686-smp
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg to choose your correct video driver, fglrx or nvidia
: why would it work when I turn off the wireless if it's a video card problem ?
oh, it finished booting? i thought it wouldn't yet
: yes it booted, it doesnt work... the screen is down
: and i know everything'll be fine if i turn off the wireless and reboot
if the screen is down, it's not so easy to fully test the wireless
: but I can't configure it when it's not turned on while booting
: i got the wireless to work
: but when i reboot after the first boot, it won't work again
did you configure the wireless from the cmdline or network-admin?
